name: Satyr and Swan
description: A younger version of Q has the perfect plan to help. He'll create more Q... by fathering them. Who would turn down an encounter with a god? Put a stop to this wannabe Zeus before he creates a trail of broken hearts across the universe!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of B. Crusher, Rand, Kim, Scoundrels, Lothario Q, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Prometheus, La Sirena, or Val Jean will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: B. Crusher, Rand, Kim, Scoundrels or Lothario Q

featured_crew.name: Troi
featured_crew.flavor: Celebrating their marriage, Deanna enjoys the festivities of her human heritage with a traditional reception.

featured_crew.name: Rand
featured_crew.flavor: In 2266, Yeoman Janice Rand had an encounter with a young boy who could not control Thasian powers.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "So few Q left, and my older self is nowhere to be found. Well, fear not, mortals. I can create more Q... with willing partners. Say, what do humans find more attractive, a stratus cloud or a cirrus?"

"Just like the mythological Zeus... except he's real, and dangerous. Can he even mate with other species? What would be the quality of life for the resultant offspring, and what dangers could it pose to the carrier?"
"And what's a god-like being's definition of willing? This is unethical, to say the least, on top of Doctor Crusher's concerns. We have to stop him, Captain, him and his 'ship of love...'"
"For all the times you humans have called me an imbecile throughout history, you certainly seem unable to deal with that imbecile every time he returns. What's the younger me up to now?"
"You--the younger you, I mean--has a perverse plan to repopulate the universe with Q by mating with other species."

responses.text: "You can't think this is a good idea... I hope."
"Yes, we're very lucky. Can you help us stop him?"
"Your response is both shocking and utterly unsurprising."

screens.text: "Perverse? That's quite a choice word, Ensign. You mortals should count yourselves lucky any Q--let alone THIS Q--would even think of mating with a subspecies such as yourselves."
"At least it's a new idea. You can't say I'm not trying to help."
"Now you know how I feel, every time a human opens their mouth."

"Yes, yes, we can't allow my younger self to go around blessing unsuspecting mortals with his progeny. Continue lobbing your ant-like efforts across his bow, and I'll prepare a nice black hole for him."
